Curran,

You couldn't have picked a better school to study.=C2=A0 I too hav=
e had taikan and find it to be just pure drooling material.=C2=A0 Even if y=
ou separate the fact that the schooled recognized the mantis in a lot of th=
eir works (just showing their high class taste), their mastery over kinko w=
ork is clearly demonstrated over and over.=C2=A0 The Maeda family did a goo=
d job in sponsoring the local talent to say the least!=C2=A0 Would love to =
see/hear and feel (you really can feel the quality in their work), but I wo=
uld settle for any info you can share.=C2=A0 Good luck with it.
Ken

>I have had the=
 Kaga Kinko Taikan for many years and recently purchased a quiet Maeda mon =
mitokoromono of Kaga work. I just passed on a nice Kaga Goto kozuka that I =
did like but felt was priced too high. It seems July would be a good month =
to devote to the study of Kaga Kinko.
>
>If anyone has any papered Kaga Kin=
ko or Kaga Goto items, I'd love to see any pictures and share any insights =
into these works.
